musicalLanguage.description: The epic piano ballad that proved hard rock bands could be deeply emotional. The intro uses arpeggiated chords in C major with a soaring melodic line that builds from quiet contemplation to dramatic intensity. This arrangement focuses on the iconic piano introduction.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro-Verse (8 bars) — C-Csus4-C-Dm-G-C progression with arpeggiated accompaniment
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: C major with suspended 4th — the signature rocking between C and Csus4
Bars 5-6: Dm to G — the dramatic harmonic lift that signals the verse is arriving
Bars 7-8: Full chordal resolution — the arrangement opens up to its grandest texture
teachingGoals: Arpeggiated accompaniment patterns in C major
Suspended chord resolution — Csus4 to C
Building dynamics across a phrase from p to f
styleTips: The arpeggiation should be fluid and romantic, not mechanical
Build the dynamics gradually — this is an epic, and epics need a slow burn
The sus4 to major resolution is the emotional heart — give it space

measures.rightHand: G4:e C5:e E5:e C5:e G4:e C5:e E5:e C5:e
measures.teachingNote: C major arpeggiation — the gentle opening. Let it shimmer.

measures.rightHand: G4:e C5:e F5:e C5:e G4:e C5:e E5:e C5:e
measures.teachingNote: Csus4 to C — F5 resolves to E5. This tiny movement is the emotional hook of the intro.

measures.rightHand: G4:e C5:e E5:e C5:e G4:e C5:e E5:e C5:e
measures.teachingNote: C major again — repetition builds the hypnotic quality.

measures.rightHand: G4:e C5:e F5:e C5:e G4:e C5:e E5:e C5:e
measures.teachingNote: Csus4 to C again — the rocking motion is now established. Like breathing.

measures.rightHand: F4:e A4:e D5:e A4:e F4:e A4:e D5:e A4:e
measures.teachingNote: D minor — the harmony shifts and the mood darkens slightly. A new color.

measures.rightHand: D4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e D4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: G major — the dominant chord. Building toward the climactic return to C.

measures.rightHand: E4 G4 C5:q D4 G4 B4:q C4 E4 A4:q D4 F4 B4:q
measures.teachingNote: Full chords — C-G-Am-G. The arrangement fills out to its grandest moment.
C major finale — a rich chord followed by a soaring E5. The intro resolves with grandeur.
